name: Blue Jazz
detail: The flower grows in a sphere to invite as many butterflies as possible.

name: Cauliflower
detail: Valuable, but slow-growing. Despite its pale color, the florets are packed with nutrients.

name: Coffee Bean
detail: Plant in spring or summer to grow a coffee plant. Place five beans in a keg to make coffee.

name: Garlic
detail: Adds a wonderful zestiness to dishes. High quality garlic can be pretty spicy.

name: Green Bean
detail: A juicy little bean with a cool, crisp snap.

name: Kale
detail: The waxy leaves are great in soups and stir frys.

name: Parsnip
detail: A spring tuber closely related to the carrot. It has an earthy taste and is full of nutrients.

name: Potato
detail: A widely cultivated tuber.

name: Rhubarb
detail: The stalks are extremely tart, but make a great dessert when sweetened.

name: Strawberry
detail: A sweet, juicy favorite with an appealing red color.

name: Tulip
detail: The most popular spring flower. Has a very faint sweet smell.

name: Unmilled Rice
detail: Rice in its rawest form. Run this through a mill to increase the value.

name: Blueberry
detail: A popular berry reported to have many health benefits. The blue skin has the highest nutrient concentration.

name: Corn
detail: One of the most popular grains. The sweet, fresh cobs are a summer favorite.

name: Hops
detail: A bitter, tangy flower used to flavor beer.

name: Hot Pepper
detail: Fiery hot with a hint of sweetness.

name: Melon
detail: A cool, sweet summer treat.

name: Poppy
detail: In addition to its colorful flower, the Poppy has culinary and medicinal uses.

name: Radish
detail: A crisp and refreshing root vegetable with hints of pepper when eaten raw.

name: Red Cabbage
detail: Often used in salads and coleslaws. The color can range from purple to blue to green-yellow depending on soil conditions.

name: Starfruit
detail: An extremely juicy fruit that grows in hot, humid weather. Slightly sweet with a sour undertone.

name: Summer Spangle
detail: A tropical bloom that thrives in the humid summer air. Has a sweet, tangy aroma.

name: Sunflower
detail: A common misconception is that the flower turns so it's always facing the sun.

name: Tomato
detail: Rich and slightly tangy, the Tomato has a wide variety of culinary uses.

name: Wheat
detail: One of the most widely cultivated grains. Makes a great flour for breads and cakes.

name: Amaranth
detail: A purple grain cultivated by an ancient civilization.

name: Artichoke
detail: The bud of a thistle plant. The spiny outer leaves conceal a fleshy, filling interior.

name: Beet
detail: A sweet and earthy root vegatable. As a bonus, the leaves make a great salad.

name: Bok Choy
detail: The leafy greens and fibrous stalks are healthy and delicious.

name: Cranberries
detail: These tart red berries are a traditional winter food.

name: Eggplant
detail: A rich and wholesome relative of the tomato. Delicious fried or stewed.

name: Fairy Rose
detail: An old folk legend suggests that the sweet smell of this flower attracts fairies.

name: Grape
detail: A sweet cluster of fruit.

name: Pumpkin
detail: A fall favorite, grown for its crunchy seeds and delicately flavored flesh. As a bonus, the hollow shell can be carved into a festive decoration.

name: Yam
detail: A starchy tuber with a lot of culinary versatility.

name: Ancient Fruit
detail: It's been dormant for eons.

name: Cactus Fruit
detail: The sweet fruit of the prickly pear cactus.

name: Fiber
detail: Raw material sourced from plants.

name: Mixed Seeds
detail: There's a little bit of everything here. Plant them and see what grows!

name: Pineapple
detail: A sweet and tangy tropical treat.

name: Taro Root
detail: This starchy root is one of the most ancient crops.

name: Sweet Gem Berry
detail: It's by far the sweetest thing you've ever smelled.

name: Tea Leaves
detail: The young leaves of the tea plant. Can be brewed into the popular, energizing beverage.
